title: US Ramps Up Monitoring of Crypto Miners' Energy Use
description: The Energy Information Administration will track U.S. crypto miners' energy consumption following an “emergency collection of data request.”

title: 9 spot Bitcoin ETFs added 142K BTC in January, GBTC dumped 132K
description:
Despite aggressive selling by the Grayscale Bitcoin Trust ETF, the spot Bitcoin ETF ecosystem in the U.S. collectively added around 10,000 BTC in January.

The Grayscale Bitcoin Trust (GBTC) exchange-traded fund (ETF) was aggressively selling Bitcoin (BTC) in January, but other ETFs bought significantly more BTC.

According to public holdings data tracked by Cointelegraph, GBTC dumped a total of 132,195 BTC in January, reducing its Bitcoin stash by 21% from 619,220 BTC on Jan. 11 to 487,025 BTC on Jan. 31.

However, the nine other funds actively caught up, adding 142,294 Bitcoin in total since the first trading day. The non-GBTC ETFs have increased their holdings by as much as 674%, from just 18,390 BTC at the trading start to 160,684 BTC as of Jan. 31.

Read more

title: Argentina Scraps Crypto Taxes in Legislative Turnaround
description:
The bill initially contained provisions that would have required taxpayers to disclose ownership of previously undeclared assets. This includes cryptocurrencies. However, the Minister of Interior, Guillermo Francos, said that the government’s priority is to foster rapid economic development. Also, to ensure legislative efficiency by leading to the removal of these crypto tax clauses. Argentina Navigates […]
